newsitem.title: FRANCE: Nantes airfreight traffic up 11.3 pct Jan-Sept.
newsitem.headline: Nantes airfreight traffic up 11.3 pct Jan-Sept.

text.p: Nantes-Atlantique airport said air cargo traffic in the first eight months of the year totalled 1,561 tonnes up 11.3 percent on the same period in 1995.
Since mid-September 1996, United Parcel Service, has operated a weekday Paris/CDG- Nantes cargo feeder rotation using a two-tonne capacity Beechcraft 1900 aircraft.
Nantes is also linked to DHL Worldwide Express' European hub at Brussels via an overnight all-cargo service operated by a six-tonne capacity Convair aircraft.
In addition, freight is also carried in the bellyholds of airlines passenger schedules from Nantes.
The airlines include Air France Europe and Alitalia.
KLM operates daily trucking services to Amsterdam and Paris from Nantes.
The airport is also part of Air France Europe's trucking network.
January-August 1996 postal traffic handled at Nantes totalled 4,130 tonnes, up 6.9 percent on the first eight months of last year.

French airline, L'Aeropostale, carries overnight mail between its Paris-CDG hub and Nantes on a regular basis, using Boeing 737C (quick-change) aircraft. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
